intro:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.
description:
Job Description

The Parkinson’s Disease (PD) Account Executive (AE) is responsible for maximizing business opportunities with approved on-market products (drug device combination) for the Parkinson’s Franchise. The PD AE will develop and maintain strategic business relationships with accounts through interactions with approved Movement Disorder Specialists, Neurologists, Advance Practice Providers, Health Care Professionals, nurses, executive level personnel, department managers, and various other support staff. Business relationships will focus on increasing education on product benefits/risks and awareness of current therapeutic gaps, consistent with approved labels, developing new business and expand current business, maximizing resource utilization, and increasing sales aimed at achieving sales plan for the assigned Parkinson’s product portfolio. The PD AE will also focus on building and maintaining successful and compliant working relationships with Parkinson’s Advocacy, Support groups, and other groups that support Parkinson’s patients.

Key Job Responsibilities:

Delivers effective on-label technical and scientific presentations/sales calls utilizing approved data and resources to appropriately highlight the benefits and risks of the product and create awareness of product solution addressing gap in therapeutic area - resulting in sales quota achievement.
Leverages opportunities to understand and address customer needs. Builds and maintains relationships across accounts that result in opportunities to benefit patients and HCPs.  Consistently partners with AbbVie in-field and in-house teams to identify, design and/or adapt appropriate approaches and tactics. 
Serve as lead US Commercial contact with targeted accounts in assigned geography. Appropriately and compliantly addresses needs of customer and patients through expert knowledge of AbbVie’s environment of care approach.
Creates, implements and communicates strategic and tactical plans for targeted accounts. Monitor and report sales progress. Provide routine communications to all internal and external (as applicable) stakeholders.
Attend and actively participate in local neurology society meetings, conferences, patient programs, support groups, advocacy events, etc., some of which occur in the evenings or weekends. Represent AbbVie and assigned products at such venues to build or enhance relationships and education on product, increasing awareness. Channel key information, developments or findings to internal partners/stakeholders. All attendance and communications in these forums are within OEC and Legal guidance with all product discussions on-label.
Based on individual accounts, customers and geographical dynamics, create and development business strategy, territory account plans, align appropriate resources to support tactic execution and adjust as needed.
Remain current on all clinical, market, and payer developments, trends, and issues specific to Parkinson’s Disease.
Complete all AbbVie required training and maintain adherence to all company policies and OEC/Legal procedures.
An essential requirement of your position is to meet health care industry representative (HCIR) credentialing requirements for entry into facilities and organizations that are in your assigned territory. These HCIR credentialing requirements may include, but not limited to, background checks, drug screens, and proof of immunization/vaccination for various diseases.
Represent AbbVie as a partner of choice in the Parkinson’s and Neuroscience space with HCP and Patient Organizations

Qualifications

Basic Candidate Characteristics:

3+ years Pharmaceutical Sales experience
Consistent top performer, history of successful sales performance in a challenging market space or product portfolio 
Strong business acumen: individual accountability and ownership of territory with ability to multitask in a proactive manner, solving problems and influence without authority
Proven advanced sales skills, ability to communicate novel or complex products and process while keeping it simple and overcoming customer concerns, advancing sales and gaining new business
Excellent communication and presentation skills, ability to build credibility and trust in a collaborative manner with both internal and external stakeholders
History of navigating the matrix environment within accounts and complex customers such as IDNs, Academic Institutions, Hospitals, Large Groups practices, etc.
Demonstrate a high level of patient centricity and is comfortable with compliant direct patient interaction in different forums
Preferred Qualifications:

Parkinson’s, Neuroscience, and/or Specialty pharma with 5+ years of Account Management experience with high level performance
Specialty Pharmacy product / Medical device and/or medication pump delivery sales experience (i.e., Diabetic pump)
Previous pharma leadership experience or Formal in-house development role in training, marketing, or other areas
Pharmaceutical launch experience (complex and novel products) in sales, training, marketing, or other roles
Experience providing education and partnering with Advocacy organizations and support groups
Bachelor’s degree

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 

This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. 

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. 

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

description:
Job Description

Purpose

Performs functions associated with cGMP manufacturing operations within the biologics production facility, including working with engineers in set-up and calibration tasks, as well as performing rework and quality testing related to the production of parts, components and final materials. Uses sophisticated programs (such as LIMS, SAP, automated control systems, etc.) to collect and evaluate operating data, which can be used to conduct on-line adjustments to products, instruments or equipment. Determines and may assist in developing methods and procedures to control or modify the manufacturing process.

Responsibilities

Shipping finished materials
Maintaining inventory levels
Sampling of in process and raw materials
Running glass washer / autoclave
Buffer / media preparation
Equipment preparation (CIP/SIP)
Cell culture (from vial thaw to production scale)
Column chromatography
Tangential flow filtration

Qualifications

Associates degree in science (or equivalent experience), with 2+ years relevant experience. BS, with 1+ years relevant experience.BS in Engineering, with 0+ year relevant experience.
Applies acquired job skills and company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks.
Works on assignments that are semi-routine in nature but recognizes the need for occasional deviation from accepted practice.
Normally follows established procedures on routine work, requires instructions only on new assignments.

intro:
ABOUT UNILEVER


With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.
At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.
CATEGORY INTRODUCTION


This position combines the best of strategic influence and operational impact. you’ll lead the execution of Nutrition category in collaboration with our CBD teams, utilizing data insights and customer-centric tools to meet critical KPIs (growth, profitability, market share) at the customer and channel level. If you thrive in a high-energy, performance-driven environment, enjoy fostering cross-functional partnerships, and are motivated by delivering results, this role is your platform to make a measurable impact.
JOB PURPOSE


The CSP assistant manager will drive Morocco Nutrition customer agenda, ensuring category and channel plans are implemented effectively and adapted to meet customer needs. This involves accountability to ensure platform / category verticals objectives are delivered via channel & customer growth strategies & supported by holistic trade investment. You will ensure our category growth strategy is reflected in all customer and market plans, directly impacting the shopper experience – working closely with platform marketing & CSP & delivering via CBD teams.
WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE


S&OP
Responsible for forecasting by category/channel across categories Onboard the CBD inputs into the S&OP. Owns the trade activity grid by Category/ channel/customer
Category Growth Strategies


Localise (Develop and deploy) CGS at channel and customer level, Work closely with Brand, CMI, NRM, Shopper Marketing to build Customer sell-in
Innovation


Define national innovation & launch plan to channels/customers. D4C/D4R: executes locally AND integrates upstream into BU
Targets and Budgets


Allocate USG targets and investment to deliver strategy by channel and customer Define budgets by channel and customer to deliver UOM target from BU. Manage the TTS spending E2E
Pricing and promotions, Mix


Own Pricing & Promo strategy in collaboration with marketing. Lead monthly forecasting process and report and own Pricing & Promotions Mix NRM:  Ownership of L4 and L5 along with CBD
Execution


Deploy strategically aligned commercial plan in Market via CBD Deploy launch plans to channels/customers to ensure strength of execution Define channel / Customer Execution: (SoS, TDP). Shopper / Digital marketing led Assist the CBD team in formalizing the annual JBPs for key customers in the country.
Capability


Deploy core capabilities required to win by Channel and Customer. Catman / Shopper / NRM
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED


Experiences & Qualifications


3 years relevant Category & Customer experience 1-2 years Account management experience is an advantage Customer Facing experience combined with Brand Building experience is ideal Shopper Marketing or Brand Building experience is desirable
competences:
Skills


Innovation mindset Commerce channels execution and digital business models Commercial Strategy and Business Acumen /NRM Category Growth Management Data-Drive Mindset Entrepreneurial Leadership Digital Commerce Customer and Retailer Understanding Customer Relationship Stakeholder Management Process Thinking (Discipline) Strategic Thinking
Leadership


You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team deliver with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins. You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors

+ PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others. + PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
+ TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people – coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
+ PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
+ CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
+ BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.
Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
Vielfalt ist Teil unserer Kultur!
Wir arbeiten stets daran, dass Du Dich bei uns respektiert und sicher fühlst und jeden Tag Dein authentisches Selbst einbringen kannst - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, körperlicher Einschränkungen oder sexueller Orientierung.
Wir sind für Dich da, wenn Du aufgrund körperlicher Einschränkungen Unterstützung während des Bewerbungsprozesses brauchst.
Bewerbungsfotos sind bei uns nicht erforderlich.

You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team deliver with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins. You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors

+ PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others. + PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
+ TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people – coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
+ PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
+ CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
+ BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.

intro:
ABOUT UNILEVER


With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.
At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.
CATEGORY INTRODUCTION


This position combines the best of strategic influence and operational impact. you’ll lead the execution of Nutrition category in collaboration with our CBD teams, utilizing data insights and customer-centric tools to meet critical KPIs (growth, profitability, market share) at the customer and channel level. If you thrive in a high-energy, performance-driven environment, enjoy fostering cross-functional partnerships, and are motivated by delivering results, this role is your platform to make a measurable impact.
JOB PURPOSE


The CSP assistant manager will drive Morocco Nutrition customer agenda, ensuring category and channel plans are implemented effectively and adapted to meet customer needs. This involves accountability to ensure platform / category verticals objectives are delivered via channel & customer growth strategies & supported by holistic trade investment. You will ensure our category growth strategy is reflected in all customer and market plans, directly impacting the shopper experience – working closely with platform marketing & CSP & delivering via CBD teams.
WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE


S&OP
Responsible for forecasting by category/channel across categories Onboard the CBD inputs into the S&OP. Owns the trade activity grid by Category/ channel/customer
Category Growth Strategies


Localise (Develop and deploy) CGS at channel and customer level, Work closely with Brand, CMI, NRM, Shopper Marketing to build Customer sell-in
Innovation


Define national innovation & launch plan to channels/customers. D4C/D4R: executes locally AND integrates upstream into BU
Targets and Budgets


Allocate USG targets and investment to deliver strategy by channel and customer Define budgets by channel and customer to deliver UOM target from BU. Manage the TTS spending E2E
Pricing and promotions, Mix


Own Pricing & Promo strategy in collaboration with marketing. Lead monthly forecasting process and report and own Pricing & Promotions Mix NRM:  Ownership of L4 and L5 along with CBD
Execution


Deploy strategically aligned commercial plan in Market via CBD Deploy launch plans to channels/customers to ensure strength of execution Define channel / Customer Execution: (SoS, TDP). Shopper / Digital marketing led Assist the CBD team in formalizing the annual JBPs for key customers in the country.
Capability


Deploy core capabilities required to win by Channel and Customer. Catman / Shopper / NRM
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED


Experiences & Qualifications


3 years relevant Category & Customer experience 1-2 years Account management experience is an advantage Customer Facing experience combined with Brand Building experience is ideal Shopper Marketing or Brand Building experience is desirable

intro:
Help shape the future of mobility.

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your Role:

As a Manufacturing Engineer you will be part of a global, diverse and collaborative team and contributing on high sophisticated compute and sensing products driving to a safer, greener and more connected future of mobility.

In this role you will play a key role in Aptiv . You will ensure project management fairly with engineering changes also with the annual change model, while guaranteeing project performance as well as these various accountabilities:

Ensure the implementation of engineering changes in coordination with the service center.
Ensure the right connection between engineering changes and continuous improvement.
Ensure the application and monitoring of changes according to the schedule and standard procedures for project development.
Ensure good management of auxiliaries.
Ensure a good connection with engineering / EOS / SAP / GSD-M / PFMEA’S system managers.
Ensuring the revision of PFMEA's for engineering changes and application of the required actions.
Ensure the smooth running of customer audits.
Your Background:

Engineering degree or Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering or equivalent.
 Freshly graduated or with one year experience in the automotive industry or similar position.
Advanced English is mandatory
Knowledge of manufacturing process
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Problem solving techniques

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Clinical Education Manager - Healthcare, and you will actively participate in the satisfaction of our customers and users, based in Casablanca, Morocco.

Your role:

You will act as main customers’ contact regarding Application and Education topics, and you will take all necessary actions to ensure high customer satisfaction results including acting as first point of escalation
You will establish and maintain contact with customers and internal stakeholders to provide technical and business support
You will use your in-depth knowledge and your analytical thinking to execute superior strategy, by addressing processes, setting new parameters, and being source of ideas
You will manage direct reports, ensuring the team members have the right competences mix and mindset to provide world-class service to our customers. You will also ensure the staffing and performance development of the team
You will be directly responsible on Application/Education P&L and Education Revenue driving
You will manage and ensure a high level of performance by application department by monitoring all relevant KPIs
Your qualifications and characteristics:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or equivalent
Minimum of 8 years' experience in the medical imaging industry
You effectively managed a team of direct reports
Advanced leadership and interpersonal skills, with the capacity to motivate, develop, and manage team performance
You are customer oriented, and have a strong understanding of customer services requirements and best practices
Excellent interpersonal skills with strong ability to manage customer relationships, ensuring high satisfaction
Proven analytical skills to identify and resolve problems, with the capacity to handle conflicts effectively
In-depth knowledge of P&L management, with the ability to drive Education-related revenue and ensure financial performance
Strong oral and written communication skills
Fluent in Arabic, French and English.

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work:
When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. Our client is revolutionizing the way businesses manage their assets. Trusted by leading companies across industries like media, production, entertainment, broadcast, higher education, and large corporations, we are on a mission to provide efficient and exciting solutions for asset management. Join our team and be part of a fast-growing global company.

Location:
Fully-remote, Full-time, 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Job Overview:
We are looking for a driven SaaS Data Analyst to play a key role in structuring, analyzing, and utilizing data to drive strategic decisions and scale operations. In this role, you will design and build data models, create insightful reports, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to leverage data for improving business performance.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Modeling & Structuring:
Design and maintain scalable data models to serve as the foundation for analytics and reporting.
Organize raw data into meaningful structures for easy cross-departmental access and use.

Report Building & Insights:
Develop dashboards and reports using BI tools to visualize key metrics and business insights.
Deliver actionable insights to support decision-making across sales, marketing, finance, and customer success.

Collaboration:
Act as a liaison between teams, understanding their data needs and delivering tailored solutions.
Work closely with stakeholders to identify data-driven process improvements.

Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security by implementing best practices for data management.
Troubleshoot data inconsistencies and work with engineering or IT teams to resolve issues.

Strategic Input:
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable business recommendations.
Identify trends and opportunities to enhance business performance and customer satisfaction.

What We’re Looking For:


Experience:
2-4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or subscription-based business model.

Technical Skills:
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with data visualization BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Familiarity with data warehouses such as Snowflake.

Business Skills:
Strong business acumen with the ability to understand the needs of various teams and translate them into data-driven insights.
Ability to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes.

Soft Skills:
Excellent communication and presentation skills to explain technical data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively across teams and departments.

Preferred Skills:
Experience in building automated reporting pipelines.
Familiarity with SaaS KPIs.

Ideal Candidate:
The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, especially within SaaS or subscription-based environments. You are proficient in SQL and familiar with data visualization tools, ready to work with large datasets, and capable of turning raw data into actionable insights. The candidate must possess excellent communication skills to explain complex data to stakeholders and work collaboratively with various teams. You should be detail-oriented, proactive, and eager to drive business improvements through data.

Non-negotiables:
At least 2 years of experience working in a SaaS or subscription-based business.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools.
Strong communication skills to engage with non-technical teams and explain data insights.

Why Join Us?
At our client, we embrace a dynamic and fast-growing global team environment. We value creative thinking, diverse perspectives, and a culture of collaboration. Join us and experience:
Flexibility with work hours and the option to work from home.
Access to top tools for doing your work efficiently.
Comprehensive benefits, including health, financial, and wellness perks.
A company culture that values every team member and offers opportunities for growth.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

Our client is a construction SaaS startup providing data analytics to construction teams, helping them manage job sites more effectively. They work with top land developers, home builders, contractors, and engineers across the US and Canada. As a fast-paced, Series B company, our client is scaling operations and looking for a Sales Data Operations Specialist to help grow alongside them.

Role Overview:

As a Sales Data Operations Specialist, you are to manage data operations that support our Sales and SDR teams. You will handle large data sets, automate processes, ensure data integrity, and provide critical analysis and reporting. This role also requires expertise in data scraping tools to source market information and identify new business opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Management & Reporting: Manage data operations, develop reports, and deliver actionable insights to provide comprehensive support to sales and SDR teams.

Data Sourcing: Use tools like ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, RocketReach, etc., to source and acquire relevant market and lead information.

Data Processing: Export, clean, and prepare data sets for SDR cadences, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and alignment with business needs.

Process Automation: Design and implement automated processes to enhance the efficiency and scalability of data-related tasks.

Salesforce Management: Maintain data integrity in Salesforce, optimizing it to support sales operations and ensure accurate tracking of leads and opportunities.

Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Revenue Operations teams to align data-driven strategies with organizational goals.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Non-Negotiable Requirements:

Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in data management or a similar field.

Proactive problem-solving approach.

Strong attention to detail.

Fluent in English with excellent communication skills (written and verbal).

Proven experience with data platforms such as ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and RocketReach.

Experience with Salesforce, including data management and reporting functionalities.

Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment.

Strong analytical skills and experience with large data sets.

Ideal Candidate Profile:

Data-Driven: Comfortable working with large data sets and proven ability to extract actionable insights to inform sales strategies.

Tech-Savvy: Experience with tools like Salesforce, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, RocketReach, and potentially SalesLoft.

Process-Oriented: Experience designing and implementing automated processes that improve efficiency and scalability.

Problem Solver: Proactively tackle challenges with minimal supervision, offering creative solutions to improve data-related operations.

Construction Industry Experience: Experience within the construction market or related industries is a plus, but not required.

Team Player: Collaborative, able to engage effectively with cross-functional teams and ensure smooth workflows and alignment with broader business goals.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

titre: Lead Data Intégration: Interfaces, API, Java, ETL, Talend, EPM
intro:
NOTRE MISSION

L’optimisation du cycle d’élaboration budgétaire, le pilotage de la performance financière et la planification sont au cœur de notre métier. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans la mise en place d’un processus contributif et collaboratif et identifions les indicateurs pertinents afin d’élaborer des tableaux de bord efficaces pour nos clients.

Adoptez les meilleurs solutions – à tous les niveaux de votre entreprise

Nous recherchons notre Lead Data Integration basé(e) au Maroc qui sera responsable de la conception, du développement et de la mise en œuvre des solutions de gestion et d'intégration des données pour nos clients. Le/la titulaire du poste devra gérer et coordonner une équipe de développeurs de données et travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos équipes et celles de nos clients pour assurer l'intégration et la qualité des données.

Responsabilités:

Concevoir, développer et maintenir les solutions de gestion et d'intégration des données de l'entreprise
Coordonner et superviser une équipe de développeurs de données
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes interne et clients pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et s'assurer que les solutions répondent à ces besoins
Évaluer les outils et les technologies pour l'intégration et la gestion des données et recommander les meilleurs choix
Développer et mettre en œuvre des politiques et des procédures pour assurer la qualité et la sécurité des données
Travailler avec les équipes informatique clients pour assurer l'intégration des données dans les systèmes existants
Évaluer les performances de l'ensemble du système de gestion des données et apporter des améliorations en conséquence
Fournir des rapports sur l'état du système de gestion des données et des recommandations pour des améliorations futures.

Description de l'entreprise
Notre mission depuis 30 ans ? Être présent au bon moment !

Notre expertise ? Accompagner nos clients à capter l’attention de l’utilisateur et transformer cette interaction furtive en une interaction mémorable. C’est dans cette optique que nous accompagnons les entreprises dans la mise en œuvre, et le pilotage de dispositifs digitaux pour une expérience utilisateur réinventée.

La juste interaction, c’est quoi ? C’est capter notre attention au bon moment, au bon endroit et la convertir en envie et en confiance. Un équilibre subtil entre le trop et le trop peu. Entre le trop tôt et le trop tard.

Devenez SQLien et faites partie de cette grande aventure au sein d’une société à taille humaine, mais avec de grandes ambitions. Nous sommes plus de 2200 talents sur plus de 13 pays et 3 continents.

Notre culture ? Oser et créer.
description:
Description du poste
En tant que Data Engineer GCP, vous serez rattaché(e) à la direction data, et vous aurez en charge de :

Gérer la maintenance évolutive et corrective des différents modules techniques permettant d’opérer la dataplateforme du projet.

Intégration des données externes de type fichier, appel de webservice ou consommation de TOPIC (Webmethod universal messager et Kafka).
Configurations sur Terraform.
Serveur SFTP.
Sécurité IAM.
Gestion d’un portail spécifique HTML/JAVA.
Pipeline de donnée ELT/KPI via SQL.
Gérer le Run de la plateform :

Suivi des traitements quotidiens et résolution des anomalies.
Suivi de la performance.
Gestion de l’obsolescence des techno utilisées.
Veille technologique & suivi de Roadmap.

Qualifications
Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, ou domaine équivalent.
Vous justifiez d’au moins 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data ingénieur sur Google Cloud Platform.
Bonne capacité d'intégration dans une équipe AGILE nécessitant écoute et bonne communication et coopération.
Capacité d'analyse et de synthèse.
Bonnes qualités rédactionnelles.
Une connaissance Retail est souhaitée (vente /Back office marchandise/back office Supply chain/marketing).

Informations complémentaires

Un environnement dynamique et innovant, au sein d’une équipe passionnée par les technologies de données.

Projets innovants et variés dans un environnement stimulant. 
Opportunité de formation et de certification sur les technologies Microsoft. 
Flexibilité de travail (télétravail partiel).

intro:
Our client, specializing in offering strategic financial consulting services to mission-driven social enterprises and non-profits, is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Financial Analyst to support their CFOs in analyzing financial data and improving decision-making processes. In this role, you will handle a variety of tasks related to financial modeling, data storage, and reporting, ensuring that all data is accurate and accessible. You will work closely with the CFO team to deliver accurate financial analysis and insights.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM PST

Role Overview:
The Financial Analyst will create and maintain advanced financial models using Excel, assist with financial data analysis, and work with data from QuickBooks and other financial systems. You will provide support to CFOs and ensure accurate and actionable insights that will guide the client’s decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Financial Data Modeling: Create and maintain advanced financial models using Excel to assist with decision-making and business strategy.

Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze and track financial data, ensuring consistency and accuracy across reports.

QuickBooks Integration: Work with data from QuickBooks and other financial systems to ensure financial reports and data modeling are accurate and up-to-date.

Client Satisfaction: Ensure that all financial models meet the needs and expectations of the CFOs and clients, maintaining a high level of accuracy.

Collaboration with CFOs: Work closely with CFOs to provide ongoing support in analyzing financial data and delivering actionable insights.

Qualifications:

Experience: 2+ years experience in data analysis and financial modeling with a strong background in Excel. Must have experience building driver-based, forward-looking financial models. Experience as an investment banker or in financial planning & analysis is ideal.
competences:
Skills: Proficient in creating complex financial models and working with large datasets. Attention to detail and the ability to work with financial data is essential.

Software Knowledge: Strong understanding of QuickBooks and Google Drive for financial data storage and collaboration is highly preferred.

Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to explain complex data and insights clearly to the team and clients.

Client Focus: Ability to understand the needs of clients and deliver data analysis that aligns with business goals.

What Success Looks Like:

Accurate Financial Models: Consistently deliver accurate and insightful financial models that drive business decisions.

Efficiency: Timely completion of data analysis and reporting tasks with minimal errors.

CFO Satisfaction: CFOs are confident in your ability to provide accurate financial insights and data that contribute to strategic decision-making.

Clear Communication: Effectively communicate financial analysis and insights to the team and clients.

Opportunity:

This is a great opportunity for someone with strong financial analysis skills to work closely with a growing team. You will play an integral role in shaping financial decision-making and ensuring that data is accurate and accessible for the team. If you are passionate about financial data and want to contribute to the success of a fast-growing firm, we encourage you to apply.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

titre: Associate Director, Digital Strategy Lead Biologics ( On-site Worcester, MA)
intro:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.
description:
Job Description

The primary goal of this position is to lead the digital transformation effort for PDS&T Biologics. The selected individual will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing a comprehensive data and digital strategy. This role involves establishing and leading a Center of Excellence (COE) for digital transformation and ML/AI capabilities within PDS&T biologics. The COE, which includes representatives from each functional group, will cater to the needs of scientists and work to develop a data systems architecture foundational for knowledge management, advanced data analytics, and predictive modeling. This leader will shape the vision for AI and digital strategy, influencing and driving end-to-end digital integration within Biologics CMC. This leader will collaborate closely with IT partners to evaluate and optimize data systems that enable seamless capture and connectivity of biologics process and analytical data, and establish business and data governance in partnership with other divisions within PDS&T, Dev Sci, Manufacturing, and the Quality organizations. The leader will prioritize use cases and workflow applications to enhance digital maturity and deliver measurable value to scientists

Responsibilities:

Establish and lead a Center of Excellence (COE) for digital transformation within PDS&T Biologics. 

Serve as the single point of contact for PDS&T biologics in partnering with IR, BTS, and other enterprise teams to develop key data and digital systems capabilities. 

Develop and execute a digital transformation strategy for capturing, retrieving, and connecting critical data related to PDS&T biologics workflows, promoting reusability and advanced analytics. 

Partner with scientists to develop and implement data analytics and modeling tools that support data visualization and predictive modeling. 

Collaborate with AI and digital science teams to revolutionize daily operations through transformative programs. 

Define KPIs/dashboards and communicate progress on initiatives to stakeholders. 

Influence leadership and cross-functional stakeholders for investments aligning digital transformation with PDS&T biologics business priorities. 

Represent scientists' needs and advocate for the work processes and culture needed for digital transformation. 

Benchmark internally and externally to ensure an industry-leading data and digital strategy for biologics process and analytics development. 

Build and develop leadership and technical skills in a diverse group of scientists equipped with advanced data analytics for the future.


Qualifications

PhD degree in life sciences or science-based informatics with 10+ years of pharmaceutical industry experience. 

Minimum of 8 years of experience in a relevant R&D or Operations function within the pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry. 

Proven experience in enabling new digital or data management capabilities beyond incremental improvements or routine data system implementations. 

Technical expertise including knowledge in programming languages (e.g., Python, R) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP). 

Familiarity with AI/ML platforms and tools (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar) that are relevant to biologics CMC workflows. 

Demonstrated ability to leverage AI and ML techniques for biologics CMC development to optimize processes, improve data analysis, and enhance predictive modeling capabilities. 
Critical success factors: 

Ability to maintain effective working relationships with multidisciplinary experts and leaders in a collaborative, fast-paced, goal-driven environment. 

Results-oriented with a proactive attitude, driving toward key milestones on strategic initiatives promptly. 

Team player with experience working in a matrixed environment, influencing, and aligning stakeholders. 

Demonstrated strategic leadership and change management abilities, with an innovative mindset to drive digital transformation. 

Demonstrated ability to understand scientists' needs and drive strategic change effectively. 

Broad knowledge of CMC workflows and key data and analytics that drive decision-making. 

Competence in integrating AI/ML solutions with existing data systems and workflows to facilitate seamless data capture and analysis. 

Commitment to staying abreast of the latest AI/ML advancements and trends within the pharmaceutical and biotech industries, particularly within biologics. 

Strong financial acumen for budgeting and managing improvement/new investment efforts, alongside ongoing cost management with BTS. 

Extensive IT implementation experience, ideally encompassing "enterprise" type systems, for effective liaison with scientific and IT SMEs. 

Exceptional business acumen and proficiency in business case development, organizational skills, and lean tool deployment. 


Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 

This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. 

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. 

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

intro:
Our client is looking for a results-driven and ambitious Growth Marketing Specialist with strong CRM expertise, especially in cold calling and email campaigns. This role is pivotal in driving the revenue engine by optimizing systems, processes, and campaigns that directly impact business goals. You will work closely with a talented team of CRM experts and growth marketers, gaining direct executive exposure and mentorship. As part of this fast-growing company, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of their growth operations, directly impacting their journey towards a $50M revenue goal.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities

Lead List Management: Download, enrich, and upload lead lists into the CRM, ensuring the sales team has high-quality prospects for outreach. Collaborate with the sales team to prioritize and refine targeting strategies using CRM data analysis. Use data-driven insights to optimize lead segmentation and targeting to enhance campaign effectiveness.

Outreach Optimization: Analyze and optimize cold email and calling outreach strategies to maximize response rates and lead qualification. Work closely with cold calling teams to troubleshoot issues and improve effectiveness. Track and optimize the sales funnel, identifying stages where deals are often lost and recommending strategies to improve conversion rates.

CRM & Data Management: Own and manage the CRM (HubSpot), ensuring accurate maintenance of leads, deals, and workflows. Build and automate CRM workflows to enhance team efficiency and ensure a seamless lead-handling process. Address complex data issues in the CRM proactively to avoid business disruptions. Create and maintain dashboards for data visualization and decision-making.

Campaign Strategy & Reporting: Develop and execute growth campaigns using cold calls, emails, CRM automation, and LinkedIn outreach. Conduct regular performance analysis and make data-driven decisions on resource allocation and campaign adjustments. Report on key metrics such as pipeline velocity, lead quality, and campaign effectiveness, and recommend optimizations to improve results.

Collaborative Work: Partner with cold email providers to create impactful campaigns that drive engagement and results. Collaborate with the BDR team to ensure they have the tools, data, and support needed to exceed their quotas. Assist with lead qualification and follow-up to support the BDR team in maintaining a healthy pipeline.

Market Research & Analysis: Conduct market research to understand target audiences, industry trends, and competitor strategies. Use insights to refine buyer personas and identify high-yield opportunities for targeting.

What We’re Looking For

Experience: 3+ years of experience in B2B marketing or growth operations. Strong experience with CRM systems, particularly HubSpot, and marketing automation tools. Expertise in lead generation, cold outreach, and campaign optimization.
competences:
Skills: Proficiency with CRM platforms (e.g., HubSpot), email platforms (e.g., Instantly.ai), and data analysis tools (e.g., Power BI, SQL). Experience with automation tools like Zapier, Clay, or Make is a plus. Familiarity with programming languages like Python or JavaScript is a bonus. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally and manage projects effectively. Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on improving efficiency and overcoming obstacles. Data-driven mindset: decisions are based on data and insights, not assumptions.

Knowledge: In-depth understanding of CRM processes and outreach strategies (cold calling and email). Strong experience with working with data, including reporting and dashboard creation. Experience with SEO, PPC, and LinkedIn outreach is a plus but not the primary focus.

Attributes: Proactive and self-motivated with a hunger to learn and grow quickly. Highly organized, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Results-oriented with a strong focus on generating measurable outcomes.

What Success Looks Like

Lead Generation Impact: You’ll build high-quality prospect lists and create outreach campaigns that consistently drive results.

Optimized Outreach: Your efforts will lead to higher engagement rates and better-qualified leads, improving sales team productivity.

Data-Driven Decisions: Your CRM and data management skills will ensure that our sales pipeline is always healthy, with the right insights to guide decision-making.

Campaign Optimization: Your work in optimizing cold outreach and leveraging CRM tools will increase conversions and pipeline growth.

Collaboration & Results: You’ll collaborate with the BDR team, contributing to consistent pipeline growth and ensuring sales targets are met.

Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to own and drive growth operations in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You’ll have the chance to work directly with leadership, learn from top growth marketers, and build systems that will significantly impact revenue generation. If you're passionate about growth, driven by results, and eager to make a direct impact on business success, this role is for you.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

intro:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Sales Operations Specialist to support our Sales team. This role will focus on managing deal workflows, including quote approvals, pricing accuracy, and resolving deal-related issues. You will ensure the integrity of deal data in Salesforce and collaborate with various departments to streamline processes and accelerate deal closures.

Location:
Full-time, work from home, 9 AM - 5 PM, CT/PT

Key Responsibilities:

Quote Management & Approvals: Collaborate with Sales to generate, review, and approve quotes, ensuring they align with pricing models and company policies. Ensure quotes are accurate and timely, supporting strategic goals.

Deal Closure Support: Provide end-to-end support in closing deals, addressing complex questions regarding pricing, terms, and conditions, and resolving discrepancies.

Fee Schedules Management: Post revenue schedules accurately for recognized revenue, ensuring compliance with financial reporting standards.

Pricing Structure Expertise: Develop a deep understanding of the company’s pricing structure and ensure accurate quote generation.

Salesforce Data Integrity: Oversee accurate and timely entry of deal data into Salesforce, ensuring consistency and alignment with reporting needs.

Process Optimization: Identify bottlenecks within the deal approval process and implement improvements to streamline operations.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Serve as a key point of contact for deal-related inquiries, collaborating with Sales, Finance, and RevOps teams for smooth execution.

Data Accuracy & Reporting: Ensure all deal data is accurate and up-to-date. Provide actionable insights to leadership based on deal data trends, supporting forecasting and decision-making.

Non-Negotiable Requirements:

2-3 years of relevant experience in sales operations, deal desk management, or a similar role.

Proficient in Salesforce and other CRM platforms, with a solid understanding of deal data management and reporting functionalities.

Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data integrity, ensuring accurate and reliable deal data.

Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams (Sales, CS, Finance, and RevOps).

Strong problem-solving mindset, with the ability to address complex issues efficiently.

Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets for data analysis and process automation.

SaaS or B2B environment experience is preferred. Familiarity with the construction industry is a plus.

Ideal Candidate Profile:

Proven Deal Desk Expertise: Hands-on experience managing deal workflows, ensuring accurate pricing, and optimizing quote approval processes.

Data-Driven: Strong ability to work with deal-related data in Salesforce, ensuring integrity and accuracy for reporting and forecasting.

Process Improvement: Identifies inefficiencies within workflows and implements solutions to improve operational speed and accuracy.

Strong Communication Skills: Comfortable collaborating across departments and communicating complex deal information clearly and efficiently.

SaaS/B2B Experience: Experience in sales operations in SaaS or B2B environments, with a good understanding of pricing structures and deal management.

Construction Industry Knowledge: While not required, familiarity with the construction industry is highly desirable.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

Our client is seeking a data- and AB-testing-obsessed Digital Marketing Specialist with deep expertise in Facebook and Instagram advertising and extended knowledge of LinkedIn. You’ll be responsible for planning, executing, optimizing, and reporting on high-performing paid social campaigns across Meta platforms. This role requires a sharp analytical mind, strong A/B testing instincts, and hands-on experience with tracking pixels, remarketing, and conversion-focused strategies. The ideal candidate will also have modern creative skills, using tools like Canva and ChatGPT for basic creative execution.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities

Plan, build, and manage Facebook and Instagram ad campaigns focused on lead generation, conversion, and remarketing, emphasizing native form fills.

Analyze performance metrics daily to drive data-informed decisions and improvements.

Develop and execute A/B and multivariate tests on audiences, creatives, placements, and CTAs.

Optimize campaign structure, bidding strategies, budget allocation, and funnel performance to meet ROAS and CPA targets.

Set up and maintain Meta pixels, custom conversions, and tracking integrations.

Collaborate with marketing teams to develop compelling ad creatives tailored to target audiences.

Create and manage multiple forms of creative across all platforms.

Integrate campaigns into HubSpot for seamless CRM and lead funnel integration.

Build remarketing and lookalike audiences from first-party and CRM data sources.

Produce weekly and monthly performance reports with actionable insights.

Stay up-to-date on Facebook/Instagram platform changes, algorithm updates, and new features.

Requirements

2+ years of hands-on experience managing Facebook and Instagram ad campaigns with demonstrated success.

Strong proficiency in Meta Ads Manager, pixel setup, and conversion tracking.

Deep experience running and interpreting A/B tests and campaign experiments.

Comfort with analyzing performance data, generating reports, and making data-driven recommendations.

Familiarity with HubSpot for campaign tracking, lead capture, and CRM integration.

Working knowledge of landing page optimization and funnel performance.

Ability to work asynchronously on Slack with weekly video meetings.

Bonus: Experience with Google Ads and cross-platform campaign strategy.

Highly desirable: Experience creating ad creative with tools like Canva and ChatGPT.

Preferred Skills

Data-driven thinking.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment.

Solid understanding of attribution modeling and marketing KPIs (ROAS, CPA, CPL, CTR, etc.).

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Non-Negotiables

Proven hands-on experience (2+ years) managing paid social campaigns on Meta platforms (Facebook & Instagram) with measurable success.

Ability to independently plan, launch, optimize, and report on campaigns.

Deep expertise in Meta Ads Manager: pixel setup, conversion tracking, custom audiences, remarketing, and lookalike audiences.

Confident configuration and troubleshooting of tracking and attribution.

Strong strategic and analytical mindset, able to design, execute, and interpret A/B and multivariate tests on small budgets.

Execution-focused, managing campaigns end-to-end without heavy supervision.

Experience integrating paid social campaigns with CRMs (HubSpot preferred) to ensure smooth lead funnel management.

Excellent data analysis skills to optimize based on ROAS, CPA, CPL, CTR targets.

Basic creative skills with Canva and/or ChatGPT or similar tools.

Comfortable with asynchronous remote work (Slack) and weekly video meetings.

Strong written and verbal communication skills for collaboration and reporting.

Opportunity
This role offers a chance to join a forward-thinking team seeking a tactical, hands-on digital marketer focused on paid social success. You’ll manage key campaigns, execute AB tests, analyze data, and contribute to meaningful growth for B2B-focused Facebook and Instagram advertising.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

Our client is a strategic consulting firm specializing in business growth, digital transformation, and data-driven marketing solutions. With over 30 years of experience, they partner with organizations to accelerate growth through tailored strategies, CRM automation (HubSpot), and optimized digital campaigns. They seek a skilled Paid Search Specialist to join their team and drive impactful campaigns across Google Ads and other paid media channels. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a forward-thinking organization and make a significant impact on their clients' digital growth.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Role Overview:
The Paid Search Specialist will be responsible for managing and optimizing Google Ads campaigns, including Google Search, Display Network, YouTube, and more. This role requires a deep understanding of paid search strategies, data analysis, and conversion optimization. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Google Ads, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager. Experience with Meta advertising is a plus, and experience with Google Grants is a bonus.

Key Responsibilities

Manage and optimize Google Ads campaigns, focusing on Google Search, Display Network, and YouTube.

Implement and track conversions using Google Tag Manager.

Analyze and interpret data from Google Analytics to optimize campaign performance.

Work with clients to develop tailored strategies that align with their business objectives.

Create, monitor, and refine paid media strategies, ensuring maximum ROI.

Collaborate with other team members, including strategists and project managers, to execute campaigns smoothly.

Leverage A/B testing and data analysis to continuously improve ad creatives, targeting, and landing page performance.

Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, updates, and best practices in paid search and digital advertising.

Occasionally support other paid media initiatives, including Meta (Facebook/Instagram) advertising, as needed.

Must-Have Qualifications

Proven experience managing Google Ads campaigns (Google Search, Display Network, YouTube).

Strong experience with Google Analytics and the ability to analyze data to drive decision-making.

Expertise in Google Tag Manager for conversion tracking and optimization.

Familiarity with paid media best practices and strategies.

Excellent analytical skills with a data-driven approach to campaign optimization.

Ability to work on multiple campaigns simultaneously and manage competing priorities.

Nice-to-Have Qualifications

Experience with Meta (Facebook/Instagram) advertising campaigns is a plus.

Google Grants experience is a bonus.

Familiarity with other digital marketing platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads, Bing Ads).

Experience with conversion rate optimization and landing page testing.

If you're a proactive, data-driven, and experienced digital marketer with a passion for paid search and paid media, we'd love to have you join our team. Apply today and help shape the future of our client's digital strategies!
